section.title: Rule
section.para: Implementation of SCCP routing mechanism makes routing decisions based on rules . Each rule consits of three elements:

listitem.para: determines pattern to which destiantion address is compared. It has complex structure which looks as follows:
integer numer which is used in a network to indicate the preferred method of global title analysis
integer/enumerated value which inidcates which numbering plan will be used for the global title. Its value aids the routing system in determining the correct network system to route message to.

integer/enumerated value which indicates address type., Specificaly it indicates the scope of the address value, such as whether it is an international number (i.e. including the country code), a "national" or domestic number (i.e. without country code), and other formats such as "local" format.
identifies application in SCCP routing network.
determines target for messages which destination address matches pattern. It has exactly the same structure as pattern .
determines mtp layer information. If translation does not indicate local address, this information is used to send message through MTP layer. It has following structure:
name identifing one of link sets used by SCCP
local point code used as originating MTP address
remote point code used as destination MTP address
